com.gemalto.idp.mobile.ui.secureinput

Interface SecureInputBuilderV2


  • public interface SecureInputBuilderV2
    An interface that represents secure input V2.
    Since:
    4.4

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      Secure input UI OK button behavior.
      static class  SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlFocusState
      Secure input UI control focus state.

      Secure input UI control state.

    • Method Detail

      • buildPinpad

        SecureInputUi buildPinpad(boolean isScrambled,
                          boolean isDoubleInputField,
                          boolean isDialog,
                          SecurePinpadListenerV2 listener)
        Create a new secure keypad.

        Notice: This method should be called once all the necessary configurations have been done. Note that the default configuration will be applied for attributes that have not been set to custom values.

        Parameters:
        isScrambled - This boolean value indicates whether the keypad would have a scrambled key locations. The scrambling is completely random and different for each time the keypad is shown.
        isDoubleInputField - If this Boolean value is true then secure keypad will show two input box. And if it is false it will show only one input box.
        isDialog - If this Boolean value is true then secure keypad will shown as Dialog (Popup). And if it is false it will shown as View (FullScreen).
        listener - Interface to create the communication channel between library and the main application. This interface will be used when user press keypad button. Secure pin will be provided as a callback value once the user input is finished.
        Returns:
        A SecureInputUi that contains the secure keypad DialogFragment and method selectInputField.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when the listener is null
        Since:
        4.4

      • setEncoding

        void setEncoding(java.lang.String encoding)
        Set the encoding format, the encoding types available include UTF-8, UTF-16, UTF-16LE, UTF-16BE, ISO-8859-1 and US-ASCII.
        Parameters:
        encoding - Default value is "UTF-8".
        Since:
        4.4

      • setScreenBackgroundColor

        void setScreenBackgroundColor(int color)
        Set the screen background color of the keypad.
        Parameters:
        color - Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.SCREEN_BACKGROUND_COLOR.
        Since:
        4.4

        Throws:

        Since:

      • setLogoPosition

        Set the logo position.
        Parameters:

      • setLogoBarBackgroundColor

        void setLogoBarBackgroundColor(int color)
        Set the top logo bar background color.
        Parameters:
        color - Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.LOGOBAR_BACKGROUND_COLOR.
        Since:

      • showTopScreen

        void showTopScreen(boolean show)
        Set whether to display the top screen of secure keypad.
        Parameters:
        show - true to show the top screen and false to hide the top screen. Default is true.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setKeys

        void setKeys(java.lang.String keys)
        Set Character choices for the constitution of the PIN. This is a character set indicating the possible characters that can be displayed.
        Parameters:
        keys - The keys to be set, cannot be null or empty. Don't allow duplicate characters. And only digits and alphabets (both lower and upper case) are supported. Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.DEFAULT_KEYS.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when this character array is null, empty, non-alphanumeric or contains duplicate characters.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setKeyFont

        void setKeyFont(android.graphics.Typeface font)
        Set the custom font for buttons including key and the subscript of key.

        Note: This function only applies to keys and the subscripts of keys. The control buttons, i.e. OK button and delete button, are not affected by calling this method. Call the methods setOkButtonFont(Typeface) and setDeleteButtonFont(Typeface) to configure the OK button and delete button font respectively.

        Parameters:
        font - the typeface of the button text.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the font is null.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setKeyFontSize

        void setKeyFontSize(int size)
        Set the key font size.
        Parameters:
        size - the font size of keys. Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.BUTTON_FONT_SIZE
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the font size is NOT in the range of 1 to 100.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setKeyColor

        void setKeyColor(SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState state,
                 int color)
        Set the text color of the keys for normal and selected state. Note that OK and delete buttons are not included. Call the methods setOkButtonTextColor(UiControlState, int)} and setDeleteButtonTextColor(UiControlState, int)} to configure the OK button and delete button text color respectively.
        Parameters:
        state - The button state, there is no SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.DISABLED for the keys to be displayed on the button.
        color - the color to be set. Default value
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.NORMAL is SecureInputDefaultSettings.KEY_COLOR_NORMAL
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.SELECTED is SecureInputDefaultSettings.KEY_COLOR_SELECTED
        Since:
        4.4

      • setSubscripts

        void setSubscripts(java.util.List<java.lang.String> subscripts)
        Set the subscripts to be displayed aside of keys on the keypad.
        Parameters:
        subscripts - The subscript strings to be configured, can be null or empty. Default is not set.

        Note: The keys must have been set in order to set the subscripts.

        Since:
        4.4

      • setSubscriptFontSize

        void setSubscriptFontSize(int size)
        Set the font size of subscripts.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of subscripts to be configured.Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.SUBSCRIPT_FONT_SIZE
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the font size is NOT in the range of 1 to 100, or the font size is bigger than key font size.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setSubscriptColor

        void setSubscriptColor(SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState state,
                       int color)
        Set the color of subscripts for normal and selected state.
        Parameters:
        state - The button state, there is no SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.DISABLED for the subscript to be displayed on the button.
        color - The color of subscripts to be configured. Default value
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.NORMAL is SecureInputDefaultSettings.KEY_COLOR_NORMAL
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.SELECTED is SecureInputDefaultSettings.KEY_COLOR_SELECTED
        Since:
        4.4

      • setDistanceBetweenKeyAndSubscript

        void setDistanceBetweenKeyAndSubscript(int distance)
        Set the distance between key and subscripts.
        Parameters:
        distance - the distance, should be in the range from 0 to 4. Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.DISTANCE_BETWEEN_KEY_AND_SUBSCRIPT
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the distance is less than 0 or greater than 4.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setKeypadWidth

        void setKeypadWidth(float width)
        Set keypad width.

        Notice: This method must be called if developers want to call setLogoImage(Bitmap) or setLogoImage(int). Otherwise, this method is not compulsory.

        Parameters:
        width - the keypad width, should be a value >= 0.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the width is less than 0.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setKeypadHeight

        void setKeypadHeight(float height)
        Set keypad height.

        Notice: This method must be called if developers wish to call setLogoImage(Bitmap) or setLogoImage(int). Otherwise, this method is not compulsory.

        Parameters:
        height - the keypad width, should be a value >= 0.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the height is less than 0.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setKeypadMatrix

        void setKeypadMatrix(int rows,
                     int columns)
        Set the matrix (number of rows and columns) of keypad.
        Parameters:
        rows - Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.NO_OF_ROWS.
        columns - Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.NO_OF_COLUMNS.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the number of rows is NOT in the range of 1 to 8, or number of columns is not in the range of 2 to 8.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setKeypadHeightRatio

        void setKeypadHeightRatio(float heightRatio)
        Set the height ratio of the keypad against the entire secure keypad (keypad + top screen).

        Notice: This attribute only takes effect when secure keypad top screen is enabled.

        Parameters:
        heightRatio - the height ratio of the keypad, should be in the range of 0.25 to 0.5. Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.KEYPAD_HEIGHT_RATIO
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the height ratio value is NOT in the range of 0.25 to 0.5
        Since:
        4.4

      • setButtonBorderColor

        @Deprecated
void setButtonBorderColor(int color)
        Deprecated. Will be removed future major release. The API is split into two APIs; setKeypadFrameColor(int) and setKeypadGridGradientColors(int, int)
        Set the border color of all the buttons.
        Parameters:
        color - the color, default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.BUTTON_BORDER_COLOR
        Since:
        4.4

                                 int gridGradientEndColor)

        Parameters:
        gridGradientStartColor - the start color of grid gradient, default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.BUTTON_BORDER_COLOR
        gridGradientEndColor - the end color of grid gradient, default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.BUTTON_BORDER_COLOR
        Since:
        4.6

      • setDialogHeightToScreenRatio

        void setDialogHeightToScreenRatio(float ratio)
        Set the height to screen ratio of keypad in dialog mode. This method is only applicable if keypad is shown as Dialog (i.e. isDialog is true when you build the secure keypad using buildPinpad(boolean, boolean, boolean, SecurePinpadListenerV2)).
        Parameters:
        ratio - ratio of the keypad height to full screen. Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.DIALOG_HEIGHT_TO_SCREEN_RATIO
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when ratio is less or equal to zero.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setDialogWidthToScreenRatio

        void setDialogWidthToScreenRatio(float ratio)
        Set the width to screen ratio of keypad in dialog mode. This method is only applicable if keypad is shown as Dialog (i.e. isDialog is true when you build the pin pad using buildPinpad(boolean, boolean, boolean, SecurePinpadListenerV2)).
        Parameters:
        ratio - ratio of the keypad width to full screen. Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.DIALOG_WIDTH_TO_SCREEN_RATIO
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when ratio is less or equal to zero.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setButtonBackgroundImageOpacity

        void setButtonBackgroundImageOpacity(SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState state,
                                     float opacity)
        Set the background image opacity for normal and disabled state for all the buttons.
        Parameters:
        state - the state to be configured for. Not applicable for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.SELECTED
        opacity - the opacity, should be a value between 0 and 1.0. Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.DEFAULT_OPACITY
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the opacity is NOT in the range of 0 to 1.0
        Since:
        4.4

      • setButtonHighlightColorOpacity

        void setButtonHighlightColorOpacity(float opacity)
        Set the highlight color opacity of all the buttons.
        Parameters:
        opacity - the opacity, should be a value between 0 and 1.0. Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.DEFAULT_OPACITY
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the opacity is NOT in the range of 0 to 1.0
        Since:
        4.4

      • setButtonBorderWidth

        void setButtonBorderWidth(int width)
        Set the button border width for all the buttons (must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 8)
        Parameters:
        width - button border width. Default : SecureInputDefaultSettings.BUTTON_BORDER_WIDTH.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the width is NOT in the range of 1 to 8.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setButtonBackgroundColor

        void setButtonBackgroundColor(SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState state,
                              int color)
        Set the background color for all the buttons.
        Parameters:
        state - the button state.
        color - the color of the state. Default value
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.NORMAL is SecureInputDefaultSettings.BUTTON_BACKGROUND_COLOR_NORMAL,
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.SELECTED is SecureInputDefaultSettings.BUTTON_BACKGROUND_COLOR_SELECTED
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.DISABLED is SecureInputDefaultSettings.BUTTON_BACKGROUND_COLOR_DISABLED
        Since:
        4.4

      • setButtonPressVisibility

        void setButtonPressVisibility(boolean isVisible)
        Set whether the buttons should be highlighted when pressed. For security reason, it's disabled by default. User won't be able to see the state change when the button is pressed.
        Parameters:
        isVisible - Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.BUTTON_PRESS_VISIBILITY.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setMaximumAndMinimumInputLength

        void setMaximumAndMinimumInputLength(int maximumLength,
                                     int minimumLength)
        Set the maximum and minimum input length for the input field. SecureInputBuilderV2.OkButtonBehavior.NONE and SecureInputBuilderV2.OkButtonBehavior.CUSTOM require minimum and maximum input length to be the same.
        Parameters:
        maximumLength - Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.MAXIMUM_INPUT_LENGTH.
        minimumLength - Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.MINIMUM_INPUT_LENGTH.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the minimum length is NOT in the range of 0 to 16, or maximum length is NOT in the range of 1 to 16, or minimum length is bigger than maximum length.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setDeleteButtonText

        void setDeleteButtonText(java.lang.String text)
        Set the text on the delete button.
        Parameters:
        text - the text of delete button, Can NOT be null. Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.DELETE_BUTTON_NAME
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the text is null.
        Since:
        4.4

        void setDeleteButtonFont(android.graphics.Typeface font)

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the font is null.
        Since:

      • setDeleteButtonTextColor

        void setDeleteButtonTextColor(SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState state,
                              int color)
        Set the color of the delete button text to be displayed for corresponding control state.
        Parameters:
        state - the control state.
        color - the color to be set. Default values
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.NORMAL is SecureInputDefaultSettings.DELETE_BUTTON_TEXT_COLOR_NORMAL,
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.SELECTED is SecureInputDefaultSettings.DELETE_BUTTON_TEXT_COLOR_SELECTED,
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.DISABLED is SecureInputDefaultSettings.DELETE_BUTTON_TEXT_COLOR_DISABLED,
        Since:
        4.4

                          int resourceId)
        Set the image on the delete button.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - the resource id of delete button image.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setDeleteButtonImageOpacity

        void setDeleteButtonImageOpacity(SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState state,
                                 float opacity)
        Set the Delete button image opacity value for normal and disabled state.
        Parameters:
        state - the state to be configured for. Not applicable for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.SELECTED
        opacity - the opacity, should be a value between 0 and 1.0. Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.DEFAULT_OPACITY
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the opacity is NOT in the range of 0 to 1.0
        Since:
        4.4

      • setIsDeleteButtonAlwaysEnabled

        void setIsDeleteButtonAlwaysEnabled(boolean alwaysEnabledDelete)
        Set whether the Delete button should always be enabled even when there is nothing to delete. This setting is disabled by default.
        Parameters:
        alwaysEnabledDelete - Default value is false.
        Since:
        4.6

      • setOkButtonBehavior

        void setOkButtonBehavior(SecureInputBuilderV2.OkButtonBehavior okButtonBehavior)
        Set the OK button behavior.
        Parameters:
        okButtonBehavior - the behavior to be set. Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.DEFAULT_OK_BUTTON_BEHAVIOR
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when okButtonBehavior is set to SecureInputBuilderV2.OkButtonBehavior.NONE or SecureInputBuilderV2.OkButtonBehavior.CUSTOM and the maximum input length does not equal to the minimum input length set by setMaximumAndMinimumInputLength(int, int)
        Since:
        4.4

      • setOkButtonText

        void setOkButtonText(java.lang.String text)
        Set text for OK button.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to be displayed on OK button. Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.OK_BUTTON_NAME
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the text is null.
        Since:
        4.4

      • setOkButtonTextColor

                          int color)
        Set the color of the OK button text to be displayed for corresponding control state.
        Parameters:
        state - the control state.
        color - the color to be set. Default values
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.NORMAL is SecureInputDefaultSettings.OK_BUTTON_TEXT_COLOR_NORMAL,
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.SELECTED is SecureInputDefaultSettings.OK_BUTTON_TEXT_COLOR_SELECTED,
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.DISABLED is SecureInputDefaultSettings.OK_BUTTON_TEXT_COLOR_DISABLED,

                             float opacity)
        Set the OK button image opacity value for normal and disabled state.
        Parameters:
        state - the state to be configured for. Not applicable for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.SELECTED
        opacity - the opacity, should be a value between 0 and 1.0. Default value is SecureInputDefaultSettings.DEFAULT_OPACITY

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the opacity is NOT in the range of 0 to 1.0
        Since:
        4.4

      • swapOkAndDeleteButton

        void swapOkAndDeleteButton()
        Set whether to swap the position of OK button and Delete button. By default, OK button is on the left and the delete button is on the right.
        Since:
        4.4

                                  int color)
        Set the background color of the input field for for corresponding focus states.
        Parameters:
        state - the state of input field.
        color - the color of the focus state. Default value
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlFocusState.FOCUSED is SecureInputDefaultSettings.INPUT_FIELD_BACKGROUND_COLOR_FOCUS,
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlFocusState.UNFOCUSED is SecureInputDefaultSettings.INPUT_FIELD_BACKGROUND_COLOR_UNFOCUS
        Since:
        4.4

      • wipe

        void wipe()
        Wipe away all the sensitive data of the Secure Input Builder. Including clearing the character array and erasing key press record.

        Notice: The wipe will only reset the character array and scramble option. other non-sensitive configuration such as color setting and text-label setting won't be reset in this function.

        Once wipe being called, the secure keypad is required to be dismissed / closed and re-built before next time usage.

        Since:
        4.4

      • setButtonGradientColor

        void setButtonGradientColor(SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState state,
                            int buttonGradientColorStart,
                            int buttonGradientColorEnd)
        Set the start and end color of the button gradient for corresponding control state.
        Parameters:
        state - the control state.
        buttonGradientColorStart - the color to be set. Default values
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.NORMAL is SecureInputDefaultSettings.BUTTON_BACKGROUND_COLOR_NORMAL,
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.SELECTED is SecureInputDefaultSettings.BUTTON_BACKGROUND_COLOR_SELECTED,
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.DISABLED is SecureInputDefaultSettings.BUTTON_BACKGROUND_COLOR_DISABLED,
        buttonGradientColorEnd - the color to be set. Default values
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.NORMAL is SecureInputDefaultSettings.BUTTON_BACKGROUND_COLOR_NORMAL,
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.SELECTED is SecureInputDefaultSettings.BUTTON_BACKGROUND_COLOR_SELECTED,
        • for SecureInputBuilderV2.UiControlState.DISABLED is SecureInputDefaultSettings.BUTTON_BACKGROUND_COLOR_DISABLED,
        Since:
        4.8

        Set the visual effect for keypad button touch like highlight or ripple.

      • setRippleEffectParameters

        void setRippleEffectParameters(int color,
                               long durationMs)
        API to set the ripple effect parameters like duration and color.
        Parameters:
        color - The color for ripple effect parameter.
        durationMs - The duration for ripple effect parameter, unit is in millisecond. Requires setButtonTouchVisualEffect(com.gemalto.idp.mobile.ui.secureinput.SecureInputBuilderV2.ButtonTouchVisual) be called first, set the visual effect be ripple.
        Since:
        5.0
